name: Krista Carvin, MSW, RSW - ADHD Therapist
bio:
🇨🇦Adult #ADHD Therapist, Speaker & Founder
✌🏻ADHDer for #neurodivergent joy & justice 
🎤#TEDx Speaker - Neurodiversity: All minds deserve love equally

social_posts.post_text: ✨TEDx 2023 SPEAKER LINEUP Meet Krista, a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, Canada. She is the Founder of The Curious Collective, a virtual psychotherapy practice. Krista values neurodiversity. She believes all brains and bodies are valuable and worthy of authenticity. Her therapy, education, and activism work is focused on helping neurodivergent people feeling safe, well, and accepted.   Get the chance to network with Krista in-person at TEDxMcMasterU on February 11, 2023. Get your tickets NOW*, LINK IN BIO‼️  *Only 100 conference tickets available.   #ted #tedx #tedxtalks #tedxmcmasteru #hamilton #toronto #legacy #2023

Want to hear a cool story of how I know I'm learning to be kinder about my ADHD? 

Hi, I'm Krista. I'm an ADHD therapist who has late diagnosed ADHD, and it's my job to help people get curious and compassionate about neurodivergence. 

Today, I, for the entire duration of my workout was stuck in traffic. 
A past version of me would have berated myself for being late. That it was my fault; I should have known to check the GPS; I should have figured out a different route so that it could get there in time. But I had a really cool moment. I realized that in that moment I was feeling disappointed, not that I was a disappointment. 
And that's such an amazing micro moment of success that helps me know I'm really learning self-compassion.

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care. 

#adhd #adhdexplained #adhdawareness #adhdlife #adhdbrain #adhdtips #adhdproblems #adhdsupport #adhdtherapy #adhdtherapist #adultadhd #adhdadult #adhdwomen #adhdwoman #adhdmemes #neurodivergent #neurodivergence #neurodiversity #neurodiverse #neurodiversesquad #therapy #therapist #therapistsofinstagram #mentalhealth #emotions #emotionalregulation #emotionalintelligence #emotionalhealth #executivefunction #executivedysfunction

On Saturday, I shared the story of my legacy to a live audience of 100 at TEDxMcMasterU 2023. 

In March, TED will publish the story I told - Neurodiversity: All minds deserve love equally.

I followed my curiosity when saw myself in the stories of my clients and it changed my life; I hope any minds that are curious about ADHD may see themselves in my story and change their lives. 

Here are some joyful moments:

Me… ON A TED STAGE. 

FINALLY meeting my incredible clinical supervisor Christina in person after literally years of her supporting my growth @digalittledeepertherapy 

Speaker Coach Extraordinaire @john1.constant who made sure I gave the talk of my life with his invaluable feedback and kind advice: “When the moment comes, just go for it.” 

And a backstage selfie to capture the joy of the moment before an opportunity I will remember forever. 

Endlessly grateful to the @tedxmcmasteru team for making this #tedtalk dream a reality!

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care.

🧠🧡

Being an ADHD Therapist who has ADHD, is amazing for seemingly endless reasons, but one of my favourites is just how much wisdom I gain from my clients. 

In my work, I have come to learn a beautiful sign of healing your relationship with your neurodivergent self; those cool moments of calm when you embrace the ways your body wants to move itself. 

Stimming and fidgeting are both natural ways we humans express and regulate our nervous systems; we all do it, just some more clearly and consistently than others. By neurotypical standards: some ways are all good, some ways… not so much. 

Turns out, as long as your movements are safe and helpful, they are all good, YOU don’t need to change. 

What does need to change though? The lack of safety in our society to express our bodies in ways that work for us all. 🧠🧡

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care. 

#adhd #adhdexplained #adhdawareness #adhdlife #adhdbrain #adhdtips #adhdproblems #adhdsupport #adhdtherapy #adhdtherapist #adultadhd #adhdadult  #adhdwomen #adhdwoman #adhdmemes #neurodivergent #neurodivergence #neurodiversity #neurodiverse #neurodiversesquad #therapy #therapist #therapistsofinstagram #mentalhealth #emotions #emotionalregulation #emotionalintelligence #emotionalhealth #executivefunction #executivedysfunction

I decided to do my #TEDx Talk on an impulse. 

Don’t get me wrong, every word and action that came next was deeply intentional, but the initial split second reaction of believing in myself juuuust enough to get curious about “well, why not?”… that was impulsive. 

This process and publication is an example of my ADHD mind’s impulsivity at it’s greatest. I love my brain for it 🧠🧡

PS. Search my name Krista Carvin or the title Neurodiversity: All minds deserve love equally on YouTube or the TED website to check it out! 

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care.

I’m moving in a week. New city, new apartment, new OFFICE SPACE!

Looking back and projecting forward in time can be hard for ADHDers who have neurodivergent time perception*. I describe it to clients “as a sense of time that is more contextual than chronological.” I’m talking time flies when you’re having fun (and draaaaaaaags when you’re not) to the absolute MAX. 

So, I’m taking context into account and intentionally giving myself extra time and space on either side of this transition. 

A little room to reflect on my time in #hamont, and to get pumped for the next era in #barrie. I can and can’t wait!

*I prefer this term to time blindness, FYI 

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care. 

#adhd #adhdexplained #adhdawareness #adhdlife #adhdbrain #adhdtips #adhdproblems #adhdsupport #adhdtherapy #adhdtherapist #adultadhd #adhdwomen #adhdwoman #neurodivergent #neurodivergence #neurodiversity #neurodiverse #neurodiversesquad #therapy #therapist #mentalhealth  #emotionalregulation #executivefunction #executivedysfunction

Me… when I treat ADHD daydreaming like it’s my day job. 

But really, it is. 

My days at work are full of dreaming about the possibilities in a better future, and scheming up all the ways to support my clients to get there. Letting my natural daydream-hope-action process shine is one my favourite parts of being a therapist. 

You know what happens when I dream on the job? I help ADHD minds survive and thrive. 

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care.

social_posts.post_text:
Neurodiversity: All minds deserve love equally 
Krista Carvin, MSW, RSW
February 2023
@tedxmcmasteru 🇨🇦

#adhd #neurodiversity #tedtalks

This lil ADHDer and ND-affirming therapist has been busy getting up to ✨all good✨ over here at The Curious Collective.

I have been working on a MASSIVE project behind the scenes for what is honestly years now. I have been imagining an incredible dream that started to become a reality this spring… I can’t wait to share more with you this week. 

Ontario-based ADHDers, check back on Wednesday for some good news 👀

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care.

The project is “virtually” ready to go, and in true ADHD fashion my signature final-touches-time “hyperfocus” is here; loading “our” last-minute updates for you soon! 

Send us your 11:59 energy! 

Ontario-based ADHDers, check back on Wednesday for some good news 👀

Hyperfocus was handy for launching ✨Hype Our Focus✨

Please share so an ADHDer can find a community where one didn’t exist 🧠🧡

📸: the amazing @arconcreative (plus some oldies, but goodies from @raeconnell and @belowtheblonde)

#adhd #adhdexplained #adhdawareness #adhdlife #adhdbrain #adhdtips #adhdproblems #adhdsupport #adhdtherapy #adhdtherapist #adultadhd #adhdadult  #adhdwomen #adhdwoman #adhdmemes #neurodivergent #neurodivergence #neurodiversity #neurodiverse #neurodiversesquad #therapy #therapist #therapistsofinstagram #mentalhealth #emotions #emotionalregulation #emotionalintelligence #emotionalhealth #executivefunction #executivedysfunction

I had some lonely years of being: 
- ADHD-Curious (wondering if this could be me) 
- Self-Identified (oh yeah, this really is me)
- Diagnosed (formally confirmed this is really me)

So, as a therapist, I asked some thera-friends to help me create ✨Hype Our Focus✨: A Neurodiversity-Affirming Therapy Group. 

It is by and for women and non-binary ADHDers who are: diagnosed, self-identified, or ADHD-curious (and in Ontario, 🇨🇦 only, sorry eh!)

And now, it’s here. A younger version of me wants me to remember this moment, in the back of my mind, because I did it for her.

Check out our link in bio for next steps to join us🧠🧡

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care. 

#adhd #adhdexplained #adhdawareness #adhdlife #adhdbrain #adhdtips #adhdproblems #adhdsupport #adhdtherapy #adhdtherapist #adultadhd #adhdadult  #adhdwomen #adhdwoman #adhdmemes #neurodivergent #neurodivergence #neurodiversity #neurodiverse #neurodiversesquad #therapy #therapist #therapistsofinstagram #mentalhealth #emotions #emotionalregulation #emotionalintelligence #emotionalhealth #executivefunction #executivedysfunction

Hi! I’m Krista Carvin, MSW, RSW; ADHDer and ADHD Therapist in Ontario, Canada 🇨🇦. 

So excited for you to find my team as we pilot ✨Hype Our Focus✨: A Neurodiversity-Affirming Therapy Group. It is by and for women and non-binary ADHDers who are: diagnosed, self-identified, or ADHD-curious (and in Ontario, 🇨🇦 only, sorry eh!)

Sign up for our emails at the link in bio to find out more!

Sometimes, you need to navigate as you go. Just like Alison, Mary and I are doing with ✨Hype Our Focus✨ 

We have been creating this group since June and our excitement and enthusiasm had been building since then. In all of OUR excitement, we maybe didn’t remember that this is brand new to YOU, and you may need more time to get excited too! 

The beauty of doing a pilot project as we create a brand new ADHD group therapy program, is that we get to give ourselves permission to figure it out as we go! Almost like it’s something we want ADHDers in our group to learn how to do 😏

So, we are delaying the group start to October 18th 2023 so we can give more executive function wiggle room for sign ups. We also realized that we need to, you know…. ACTUALLY TELL YOU the details of the group here on IG, instead of just the email list. 

Stay tuned for a post with those actual details soon 🤭

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care.

✨Hype Our Focus✨

A Neurodiversity-Affirming Therapy Group co-facilitated by 3 ADHD Therapists in Ontario, Canada:
Krista Carvin, MSW, RSW
Alison Moreau, MSW, RSW
Marielle Tye, MSW, RSW 

Virtual sessions shared with other women or non-binary ADHDers (other neurodivergent identities are welcome, but our group’s focus is on ADHD specifically)

Each week we’ll be learning about ADHD, practicing skills for living with ADHD, and creating a community of literally like-minded people

💻 - Online for 9 sessions on Wednesday evenings from October 18th, 2023 - December 13th, 2023

⏰ - 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM (EST) 1.5 hours live on Zoom (no replays)

💸- $115/session (paid session-by-session); possibly covered under Extended Health Benefits (check with your provider!)

🇨🇦 - Open to Ontario, Canada residents only

Chat with me, Krista Carvin, RSW next week in a free 15-minute consult call to see if ✨Hype Our Focus✨ is right for you! Sign up for a Jane App video call at the link in bio (very limited availability). 

Disclaimer
While I am a Registered Social Worker in Ontario, 🇨🇦; my content is not therapeutic advice, just general mental health education. Seek help from a local mental health professional, and if you’re unsafe, get crisis or emergency care.
